intro: Oxydectes bracteata, commonly known as the bracted oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly serrated edge. Oxydectes bracteata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
